page.title: 19THOMAS CRANMER
page.content: Aslocktons claim to fame is that Thomas Cranmer, Archbishop of Canterbury in the time of King Henry VIII, Was born here. Local legend tells that he used to sit on a small mound of earth and listen to the church bells in Whatton, And this is why he became a churchman. The mound still exists and is called Cranmers mound. He was famous for getting rid of three of Henry VIII's Wives. He is also remembered for translating a prayerbook into the common language. He was born in a house near the centre of the village. Our school is named after him and the local group of churches is called the Cranmer group.
